author: Jared Diamond
title: MLB Players Union Accuses Four Teams of Mishandling Revenue-Sharing Funds
text:
The Major League Baseball Players Association has filed a grievance accusing the Oakland Athletics, Miami Marlins, Pittsburgh Pirates and Tampa Bay Rays of failing to spend revenue-sharing money appropriately.
The union says these four teams violated the sport’s collective bargaining agreement, or CBA, which mandates that a team uses its revenue-sharing funds “in an effort to improve its performance on the field.”
